item.title: Specific Client Required
item.dc:creator: @four_twenty four twenty
item.description:
@four_twenty wrote:

The server i am using has a code in it that only allows a specific client to connect to the server. i would like to know how to remove this so i can use a different client.

in server.java there is

public static boolean enforceClient = false;

and

Properties p = new Properties();
p.load(new FileInputStream("./server.ini"));
int client = Integer.parseInt(p.getProperty(“ClientRequired”)
.trim());
world = Integer.parseInt(p.getProperty(“WorldId”));
serverlistenerPort = Integer.parseInt(p.getProperty(“ServerPort”)
.trim());
if (client > 0) {
misc.println(“Enforcing Eudora client requirement”);
enforceClient = false;
}
} catch (Exception e) {
misc.println(“Error loading settings”);
e.printStackTrace();
}

and in client.java there is

if (server.enforceClient && !officialClient) {
println(“Invalid client!”);
returnCode = 12;
disconnected = true;
return;

also my server.ini says

ClientRequired=1
WorldId=3
ServerPort=43594

i need to know what to remove from where. because every time i try, i get errors. thank you for your time.

Read full topic
